question: Mosquito causes dengue
answer:
Conclusion: Mosquitoes are associated with the transmission of dengue.

Evidence: [Source 1], [Source 2], [Source 3], [Source 5] all mention that mosquitoes can become infected with the virus after biting DENV-infected individuals and then pass the virus onto other individuals, making them capable of spreading the dengue virus within households and in the neighborhood.

sources.title: Dengue outbreak and response in Bangladesh

passage.text: The proximity of mosquito vector breeding sites to human habitation is a significant risk factor for dengue virus infection. Aedes species mosquitoes can become infected with the virus after biting DENV-infected individuals and then pass the virus onto other individuals within the vicinity. This cycle, therefore, makes the infective mosquito capable of spreading the dengue virus within households and in the neighbourhood, leading to clusters of cases.
passage.title: Dengue - Bangladesh
passage.author: WHO

passage.section_heading: Dengue outbreak and response in Bangladesh
passage.text: The higher incidence of dengue is taking place in the context of an unusual episodic amount of rainfall, combined with high temperatures and high humidity, which have resulted in an increased mosquito population throughout Bangladesh.
passage.title: Dengue outbreak and response in Bangladesh
passage.author: WHO
tags: Dengue outbreak and response in Bangladesh

passage.text: The proximity of mosquito vector breeding sites to human habitation is a significant risk factor for dengue virus infection.  Although dengue does not spread from human to human, mosquitoes can become infected after biting infected individuals. This cycle, therefore, makes the infected mosquito capable of spreading the dengue virus among households and in the neighbourhood, leading to clusters of cases.

passage.text: Dengue fever is a viral illness that mosquitoes spread in tropical areas of the world. The virus causes symptoms such as a high fever and painful headaches. Dengue fever is often mild and manageable at home with rest, pain relievers, and extra fluids. Severe cases may need treatment in a hospital.
passage.title: Dengue Fever
passage.author: Stephanie Watson

passage.text: The proximity of mosquito vector breeding sites to human habitation is a significant risk factor for dengue virus infection. Although dengue does not directly spread from human-to-human, Aedes species mosquitoes can become infected after biting dengue-infected individuals, thus creating a cycle of transmission capable of spreading dengue and leading to clusters of cases.
